title: What the salad crisis says about Britain
description: Shoppers have been left staring at empty shelves and advised by their government to eat turnips over tomatoes. But the food shortage might be more serious than it sounds, reports Joanna Partridge. Help support our independent journalism at theguardian.com/infocus
episode: What the salad crisis says about Britain
creator: The Guardian
